text.title: HUMAN ACTIVITY AND CLIMATE CHANGE
text.body: Since 1750, humans have added about 2,040 gigatons of heat-trapping CO₂ the atmosphere, mostly through burning fossil fuels such as oil and coal. Atmospheric CO₂ levels are now higher than at any point at least 800,000 years, and are rising at an unprecedented pace.
text.description: Increases in atmospheric CO₂ levels coincide with warming events.
